problem_text:
Prove or disprove that for all, but finitely many, primes p the group
\(G_p = \langle a, b \mid a^2 = b^p = (ab)^3 = (b^r a b^{-2r} a)^2 = 1 \rangle\),
where \(r^2 + 1 \equiv 0 \pmod p\), is infinite. A solution of this problem would have interesting topological applications. It was proved with the aid of computer that \(G_p\) is finite for \(p \le 17\).
J. Mennicke
